Connected Chromecast in HDMI and powered it through the USB port.My smart TV does have both youtube and netflix.  Smart TVs are still not smart enough when it comes to typing in the search box.  But having the chromecast is very convenient to send what I am watching on my cellphone to the TV.

review: Pros: If you research this item and buy it for what it's meant to be, then you won't be disappointed. I think most of the bad reviews here are from people not understanding the purpose of this item or having unrealistic expectations. I actually like the tablet or phone as a remote concept, although when I'm watching a series it is annoying that there is no auto-play of the next episode. Either way, I am very excited to see what Google comes up with next. It's hard to believe how much they were able to cram on a small thumb-drive sized device. Also, as a Roku user and DirecTV customer, this device enabled me to watch HBO Go on my TV.Cons: The developers for the software for the Chromecast need some serious help with their software change management process. This last update was a disaster and for a lot of users either made their Chromecast un-bootable or crippled their ability to cast Netflix. There are work-arounds to fix both (albeit temporarily), but if you're not an advanced user you would be dead in the water. As I mentioned before, no auto-play of the next episode of a series is also somewhat annoying.Bottom Line: I paid $25, so I feel like I got my money's worth, so I'm willing to be patient to see where Google goes with this item.
